title: ARAM random champs not so random
body: Well, just been trying to play aram on my smurf accounts, all about level 20 to 25. And I found that pretty much the last five lobbies I went into had only the free champs for all players on our team. Although I own about 15 to 20 champs on each account I never ever got an owned one just free ones along with all players in my team. OK they might be scripts and so not own any champs but why am *I* always getting one of the 10 free champs when 4 are already taken by my team and so I'd expect a maybe 1 in 2 chance of that happening each time and it happened 6 times in a row! Hmm smells fishy!

replies.body:
_**There's two theories on why that is:**_

The first theory is that ARAM is actually random, but humans are weird. 

Supposedly you're just being misguided by your brain's tendency to see patterns where there are actually none.


  + It happened to Apple when they released the [iPod shuffle](https://whywereason.com/tag/random-ipod-shuffle/). People complained that it wasn't random because the same song appeared too many times. 

     In reality the shuffle was random, but Apple changed it anyway to be pseudo-random and stop the same song from appearing too may times.

**What people don't understand is that truely random events happen in clusters.** Not to get too complex, but it's heavily based on the Poisson process/distribution. [This](http://freethoughtblogs.com/singham/2012/02/07/why-randomness-doesnt-always-look-random/) is a great article on that if you want to learn more.

__*

The other theory is that the ARAM algorithm is not actually random.

You and [many others](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/208atk/is_champion_select_in_arams_really_random/) have noticed that ARAM seems to favour Free to Play champions, over your own champions.

The _supposed_ reasoning behind this is that favouring Free to Play champions means that "ARAM only accounts" aren't as OP.

I'm with the last one. I studied statistics during my BSc years ago and spend my life taking data and assigning loose levels of probability to it.
The number of times I am getting a free champ over a truly random champ "leads me to be circumspect" concerning the "random" nature of ARAM.

Oh, good to know you come from a place of knowledge :D

I might make it a summer project gather a whole bunch of data for ARAM and finally put this question to rest. You wouldn't mind if I contact you later on for advice on that?
